citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Under protocol 220601, wild small mammals may undergo procedures that can cause more than momentary pain and
distress, including toe clipping and self-piercing ear-tagging. Some individuals may also be captured using lethal trapping
methods if deemed necessary. The protocol, however, does not adequately affirm that the investigators have considered
alternatives to these procedures and methods. This means more animals may be subjected to distressful procedures or
lethal trapping than necessary. The protocol must provide a narrative description of the methods and sources used to to
determine that alternatives were not available.
Correct by 7/31/24, or before further trapping and sampling.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(d)(1)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
Under protocol 220601, wild small mammals may undergo procedures that can cause more than momentary pain and 
distress, including toe clipping and self-piercing ear-tagging. Some individuals may also be captured using lethal trapping 
methods if deemed necessary. The protocol, however, does not adequately affirm that the investigators have considered 
alternatives to these procedures and methods. This means more animals may be subjected to distressful procedures or 
lethal trapping than necessary. The protocol must provide a narrative description of the methods and sources used to to 
determine that alternatives were not available.  
 
Correct by 7/31/24, or before further trapping and sampling. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
